title: `eth_getProof`: `Account not found`
body:
### Steps to Reproduce (Bug)
1. Sync Mainnet Besu (Bonsai / not an archive node)
2. Try this curl:

```bash
curl -sX POST -H "Content-Type: application/json" https://rpc-mainnet-eth.nodeguardians.io --data '{
  "jsonrpc": "2.0",
  "method": "eth_getProof",
  "params": [
    "0x3971EB866AA9b2b8aFEa8a7C816F3b7e8b195a35",
    ["0x65a7ed542fb37fe237fdfbdd70b31598523fe5b32879e307bae27a0bd9581c08"],
    "latest"
  ],
  "id": 1
}'
```

4. The `curl` return this error:

```json
{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"Account not found"}}
```

**Expected behavior:** Return the `eth_getProof`, working well with public nodes (for example: https://ethereum.publicnode.com) / premium RPC / our `Nethermind` node

**Actual behavior:** `{"jsonrpc":"2.0","id":1,"error":{"code":-32000,"message":"Account not found"}}`

**Frequency:** 100%

### Logs (if a bug)

- No errors in the logs, the EL is well synced:

```

```

### Versions (Add all that apply)
* Software version: 23.7.2
* Java version: 17.0.8.1
* OS Name & Version:

```env
DISTRIB_ID=Ubuntu
DISTRIB_RELEASE=20.04
DISTRIB_CODENAME=focal
DISTRIB_DESCRIPTION="Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS"
NAME="Ubuntu"
VERSION="20.04.6 LTS (Focal Fossa)"
ID=ubuntu
ID_LIKE=debian
PRETTY_NAME="Ubuntu 20.04.6 LTS"
VERSION_ID="20.04"
HOME_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/"
SUPPORT_URL="https://help.ubuntu.com/"
BUG_REPORT_URL="https://bugs.launchpad.net/ubuntu/"
PRIVACY_POLICY_URL="https://www.ubuntu.com/legal/terms-and-policies/privacy-policy"
VERSION_CODENAME=focal
UBUNTU_CODENAME=focal
```

* Kernel Version: `Linux rpc-ethereum-mainnet-01 5.4.0-162-generic #179-Ubuntu SMP Mon Aug 14 08:51:31 UTC 2023 x86_64 x86_64 x86_64 GNU/Linux`
* Cloud VM, type, size: Bare Metal
* Consensus Client & Version if using Proof of Stake: Teku / v23.9.0

### Additional Information (Add any of the following or anything else that may be relevant)
* Besu setup info - config options:

```env
ExecStart=/home/ethereum/bin/besu/bin/besu \
  --network=mainnet \
  --logging=INFO \
  --host-allowlist=* \
  --metrics-enabled=true \
  --metrics-port=6061 \
  --metrics-host=0.0.0.0 \
  --rpc-http-enabled=true \
  --rpc-http-port=8545 \
  --rpc-ws-enabled=True \
  --rpc-ws-host=localhost \
  --rpc-ws-port=8554 \
  --max-peers=10 \
  --sync-mode=X_CHECKPOINT \
  --data-storage-format=BONSAI \
  --data-path=/home/ethereum/var/lib/besu \
  --Xplugin-rocksdb-high-spec-enabled \
  --engine-jwt-secret=/home/ethereum/secrets/jwtsecret
```

* System info - memory, CPU: 64Go RAM / Ryzen 5, 6 core


The same curl is working for `Nethermind` client, but not with `Besu`. Did I miss a configuration ? Did I find an unexpected behaviour ?

Thanks for pointing this out, @chichi13.  That function is currently unimplemented for the bonsai storage format, but it shouldn't be difficult to add.  We will try to get that added for bonsai in time to be in the next release.
